page.title: 05Bridgnorth's Town Hall
page.content: Bridgnorth Town Hall is situated in the centre of the High Street and was originally a barn at Much Wenlock - being moved early in the l7th. century and erected on stilts so that traffic is able to travel underneath. Ancient Charters enable the townspeople to trade under the Town Hall on Saturday mornings until 12 noon and two way vehicular traffic is obliged to use the narrow road on the east side of the Town Hall. On the west side, the road is pedestrianised and more market stalls are sited here. In the north end of the Town Hall is the Council Chamber where Bridgnorth Town Council meets and the remainder of the building is taken up by the Courtroom in which County Court cases are heard.
